title: Firefox (Flatpak) displaying text in PDF files incorrectly
content:
When i go to open a PDF file with Firefox, the text renders incorrectly (see image) for most PDF files, but not all (i'm not sure why. And this only happens with the Flatpak version of Firefox [1]. It doesn't happen with Firefox ESR (DEB version from my distribution) [2] and it doesn't happen if i view the same PDF file with pdf.js in a non-Firefox Flatpak app (GNOME Web) [3].

I've tried reinstalling and tried starting in troubleshoot mode, but neither seemed to fix the issue.

[1]:

  • Name: Firefox
  • Version: 117.0
  • Distribution ID: mozilla-flatpak

[2]:

  • Name: Firefox
  • Version: 102.15.0esr
  • Distribution ID: BLANK (preinstalled with Debian Linux 12)

[3]:

  • Name: GNOME Web (Flatpak)
  • Version: 44.6
creator: Detnett

title: Win10: Upgrading from FF 115.1 64-bit using link on 115.2 release notes page, installed 102.15 32-bit
content:
Current OS: Win10 22H2 x86 [64-bit]

Was running FF 115.1.0 ESR [64-bit] and wanted to upgrade to the latest ESR [115.2.0 64-bit] Using this 115.1 on following release notes page, clicked the blue 'Download Firefox ESR' button www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/115.2.0/releasenotes/

[this blue button link is https://download.mozilla.org/?product=firefox-esr-latest-ssl&os=win&lang=en-US]

This downloaded file 'Firefox Setup 102.15.0esr.exe' i.e. this is the latest 102, and not 115 As I didn't notice this was not the expected version [doh! My weak excuse is I switchedg the 15 and 2], I went ahead and installed this earlier version ontop of my existing, getting the usual prompts

When I ran the 'new' FF, I got a 'You've launched an older version of Firefox' dialog Process explorer shows this app as ver 102.15.0.8634 32-bit app

I used another browser to download 115.2.0 64-bit 'Firefox Setup 115.2.0esr.exe' and installed atop then all was ok

So apart from why it downloaded the older version, shouldn't running the 102 install ontop of 115 prompt user that 1) installing an earlier version 2) installing 32-bit app when previous was 64-bit

This could have been v confusing to some users so just wanted to point it out...

FYI: I previously ran 102.14 ESR before upgrading it to 115.1 a few weeks ago

P.S. I think issue 2) has happened to me before - I didn't notice for a while [so switching bit width is transparent...impressive :-)]
creator: firefox2483

title: Erro ao abrir imagens Webp em outra janela - código estranho
content:
Olá!

Segue a descrição do problema que vem ocorrendo:

Ao clicar com o botão direito do mouse em uma imagem no formato Webp e depois clicar em "Abrir imagem em nova aba", ao invés da respectiva imagem abrir na outra aba, abre uma página com códigos estranhos. Segue print anexo. Já reinstalei o Firefox, mas não resolveu.

Obs: Isso não ocorre no Google Chrome.

Sistema operacional Windows 7.

Alguém sabe dizer o que pode ser e qual a solução?

Obrigado?

title: When clicking on a link in an external app, Firefox will open but the link will not
content:

When clicking on a link from an external app (eg. WhatsApp, Teams, etc.) with Firefox not running in the background, Firefox will open up but will not open the link. I have to go back to the app and click the link again for it to work.

This has been an issue for me for a while now and it only happens with Firefox as other browsers will work as expected.

title: FF browser crashes on Mac Ventura 13.5.1
content:
My FF (and Chrome) browser started crashing after the latest 2 updates of Mac (current version is Ventura 13.5.1). I can barely do internet surfing - browsers are crashing constantly! In case of Chrome I just see this (see ChromeCrash1 and ChromeCrash2 screenshots). In case of Mozilla the browser closes with an error. It happens on almost every site including Google maps or Linked in. Safari still works well (so far haha).

Firefox version: 117.0 (64 bit) Crash reports: I sent a lot of them, this is the link to the one of them: https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/report/index/6c86a946-2f8e-4efd-accd-279d10230904

What I have tried and what didn't help: 1. Clear cache, cookies and all data 2. Reinstall browser 3. Use incognito mode (helps, but not all the time) 4. Reinstall MacOS and install browsers again. 5. Reset NVRAM

My colleagues are using the same browser and macOS version and don't have these issues.

Thank you.
creator: astryd.mad

title: Drag and drop broken / mouse cursor not reacting
content:
On Ubuntu, drag and drop has broken for me. My mouse cursor does not seem to react to different types of content, like hovering over links. My main problem is that if I highlight a piece of text, or some other content block on a page, and drag it, it does not work as smoothly as it should.

Has anyone else experienced this recently?

I find closing Firefox helps temporarily but within 10-15 minutes the same problem occurs.

I have re-installed Firefox and I am running the latest version. I haven't experienced the problem in Safe Mode.

It only occurs on Firefox and is browser-wide.
creator: Rhys101

title: Vzhled dlaždic zkratek na novém panelu
content:
Dobrý den,

při otevírání nového panelu často používám zkratky, kterých mám 4 řady. Dříve měly dlaždice zkratek vzhled faviconu nebo "nějakého loga" stránky, na kterou odkazovaly. Dnes se mi v dlaždicích většinou zobrazují jen počáteční písmena odkazu. Jen výjimečně je tam nějaký související vzhled a to ne po celé ploše dlaždice ale pouze jako mrňavá ikonka uprostřed. Když chci v dlaždici nastavit vlastní obrázek, zadám adresu, v náhledu se mi zobrazí náhled stránky (většinou jde o nějaký výřez, ne favicon), ovšem po uložení zůstane dlaždice prázdná.

Tuším, že někde do verze Firefoxu 7x měly dlaždice po celé ploše favicon stránky na kterou odkazovaly. Bylo to perfektně přehledné.

Nevíte, jak se k tomuto stylu vrátit? Downgrade Firefoxu za mě není řešení.

Díky za všechny reakce.
creator: jiri.sramek
